resources.string: Invite friends to your workout events. Post workout events so other application users can search, view, and get directions.
View posted workout events. Search with Google maps to see upcoming workout events within a radius of where you choose (By clicking on the map).
An error occurred searching for workout events. Please try again later.
Could not find a posted workout event to remove.
An error occurred removing posted workout event.
An error occurred posting Workout Event.
Event\'s begin date is prior to the current date.
Event\'s end date is prior to the current date.
The calories burned during the time you have actually been moving during your workout.
The time you have actually been moving during your workout.

Import .gpx (Routes and Tracks) and .kml files into Google Maps. Workout Goals can access files in the Download folder. This is where files are saved from websites or emails if you do not save them to the Google Drive. Plus, you can copy files into the WorkoutGoal\'s folder. The file is imported and left in view until it is cleared or the activity is closed out. You can view distance and elevation information in a chart. Elevation data is pulled straight from the file and is not formatted in weights and measure or metric system.
Could not find .kml or .gpx files to import.

Share mapped workouts with other application users through the search feature. Creates a KML, GPX, or CSV (Comma Separated Values) file for Google Maps or Google Earth, with associated workout information. This file can be uploaded to Google Drive or emailed.

You can share your workout and make it available for other app users to search and view the workout and chart information. There is also a option for other app users to follow your workout route. This option keeps the workout route in view as long a you do not click the back button while you are using the mapped workout page. To search for workout routes in a certain area scroll Google maps to a place you want to search, then click on the search icon, enter in your criteria and click search. You must have a internet connection for this option. If you cannot find what you are looking for feel free to share any workout routes!
You can share your workout route with other app users through the share action item.
Congratulations!!! You achieved your distance goal for today.
Uploading your workout to the cloud.
Description can only be up to 255 characters.
Clear searched workouts from the map.

Position the maps over a place, click search to see if there are any shared workouts in the area. If there are the map will display their routes and information. Network connection is needed for this feature.
Show the next page of results for nearby shared workouts.
Show the previous page of results for nearby shared workouts.
The total scheduled distance for today based off of the Workout Events distance(s) for a given day of the week.
The total number of calories and distance scheduled for a week. This is a sum of each workout event\'s calories.

List of workout events by date, times, number of calories to burn, and distance to cover. Enter in your goal distance or calories you want to try and reach for that day of the week. Don\'t over do it. When workout events are saved a notification is setup to notify in the morning of upcoming workout events for the day.

View your workout goal progress. If you do not have desired weight loss entered this chart totals up the distance and calories since the goal\'s begin date. Otherwise this chart displays your goal to burn calories, your projected goal to burn calories (An average of calories burned per day), and the actual calories burned to date from the workout goal start date.
The total distance covered this week.
The total scheduled distance to cover this week. This is based off the sum of the workout events distances.
The total scheduled calories to burn per week. This is based off the sum of the workout events calories.
Daily chart of calories burned and distance traveled
Distance and calories cannot be zero.
A error occurred removed this shared workout.
Remove this workout and Stop sharing with other app users (Only if this workout has been shared).
Stop sharing with other app users (Only if this workout has been shared).
To share a workout the distance must be greater then zero.
No workouts found. Be the first to share your workouts in this area!!
Workout already is exists on in the cloud.
A error occurred saving workout to the cloud.
Workout Saved to the cloud successfully.
Search for near by mapped workout routes.
Share Workout Information. If there are heart rate readings a CSV (Comma Separated Values) file will be attached with reading data.
Please save workout events before sharing them.
Error creating KML file from workout.
Error creating GPX file from workout.
Send FeedBack, Questions, or Comments To:
This was originally a mapped workout do you want to map this workout?
An error occurred saving workout events.
Viewing the Goal chart only apply\'s if you are trying to lose weight and have the amount you want to lose every week set.
This application is not licensed. Please purchase it from Android Market.
Unable to validate license. Check to see if a network connection is available.
Error reading location with GPS. The phone\'s battery might be too low, satellites out of reach, or no coverage.
Congratulations!!! You reached your goal for calories to burn today.
The version of Google Play services on this device is not authentic
The specified account name is invalid
The app is not licensed to the user
Google Play services is out of date
The user is not signed in
Workout goal has unsaved fields. Do you want to save your workout goal?
Bluetooth health profile is not available
Displays current address and current or updated location using Location Services
Location update error. No incoming location.
Cannot get address. No geocoder available.
Google Play services: unable to resolve connection error.
Can\'t request location updates, previous request hasn\'t finished
Received an unknown activity request code %1$d in onActivityResult.
Before starting a workout it is required to enter a workout goal in order calculate calories.
You have reached the max recommend heart rate for your age.
Before starting a workout it is required to enter a workout goal in order calculate calories.
Before creating workout events it is required to enter a workout goal.
Are you sure you want to delete this event?
No calendar account was found for
To create a new calendar click on add event in the calendar app. Do you want to open the calendar app?
A calendar is required if adding workout events to the calendar.
Workout Event Calories Cannot Be Zero.
This app is only setup for Zephyr HxM BT heart rate monitor.
Could not detect any Bluetooth devices.
Upcoming Workout Event scheduled calories to burn =
End date should be after begin date
Are you sure you want quit there are unsaved events?
Calendar Account Email is a required field.
Desired Weight Loss is not a number.
Desired weight loss must be greater or equal to zero.
Height feet out of bounds select between 1–12.
Height inches out of bounds select between 1–11.
Daily calorie intake is not a number.
Losing more then 2 pounds per week is unhealthy.
Weight must be greater then 1 pound.
Age has to be greater then 0.
According to your body mass index you are already at a unhealthy weight, with a body mass index of
Your desired weight loss would put you at a unhealthy weight. Underweight body mass index is
or less your desired BMI is
For woman it is recommended that your daily calorie intake does not drop below 1200.
For men it is recommended that your daily calorie intake does not drop below 1800.
If you are below 90 lbs (40.82 kg) or above 800 lbs (362.87 kg) it is advised that you speak with your doctor or other qualified healthcare provider before creating a Workout Goal.
Goal start date is a required field.
Your phone\'s GPS seems to be disabled, do you want to enable it to capture locations?
Are you sure you want to delete this workout?
There is no chart data to view.
There are no images for this workout.
To take a picture the workout has to already be started or running.

Workout data collected during a workout. Data is only collected if bluetooth connected or in the map workout. Includes calories burned, heart rate (if bluetooth connected), distance, speed, and altitude (if workout was a mapped workout).
Workout goal illustrated by the goal information entered, actual progress, and projected as a daily average of calories burned.
A database error occurred getting this goal.
A error occurred getting this goal.
Could not load image. It might have been deleted.
An error occurred loading the camera.
Error could not save workout event.
A database error occurred saving this goal.

Pushing A Wheelchair Or Baby Carrier

Backpacking, Hiking, Walking With A Daypack
Carrying 15 Pound Load on Level Ground
Climbing Hills With 0 To 9 Lb Load

Climbing Hills With 21 To 42 Lb Load

Before starting a exercise program it is recommended to talk to your doctor. There are risks to exercise especially if you have heart disease, asthma or lung disease, diabetes, or liver or kidney disease, or arthritis. Other symptons suggestive of heart, lung, or other serious disease to be aware of before starting a exercise program include:

string.name: disclaimer_doctor2
string.li: Pain or discomfort in your chest, neck, jaw or arms during physical activity

string.name: disclaimer_doctor4
string.li: Shortness of breath with mild exertion or at rest or when lying down or going to bed

string.name: disclaimer_doctor6
string.li: A heart murmur or a rapid or pronounced heartbeat

string.name: disclaimer_doctor7
string.li: Muscle pain when walking upstairs or up a hill that goes away when you rest

resources.string: If you are unsure of your health status, have multiple health problems, or are pregnant, speak with your doctor before starting a exercise program.

The amount of weight you would like to lose. If your current weight - desired weight loss produces a body mass index (BMI) less then 18.5 then it is considered to be under weight and not recommend. Currently, normal (healthy weight) is in the BMI range of 18.5 to 25.
The amount of weight you would like to lose per week.
The number of calories you have burned this week, according to the number of workouts created this week from Sunday through Saturday.

A rough estimate of the number of calories you should burn this week to meet your workout goal. This is based off the number of pounds you want to lose per week, your current activity level, weight, age, and gender to Calculate your BMR. The Mifflin St Jeor Equation is used to calculate your BMR. The calories to burned is your (average daily calorie intake - (BMR * activity level)) + (calories to burn to lose a certain amount of weight per week)).

The projected goal date according to the average number of calories burned per day since the workout goal start date. This view also includes a chart view to illustrate projected, estimated, and actual workout goal progress.
The estimated goal date according to the workout goal information. Mainly the amount of weight you would like to lose per week.
Upcoming workout events this week. Workout events occur weekly.

Sets formatting options for the application. Weights and measures displays information in miles, mile per hour, pounds, feet, and inches. Metric system displays information in kilometers, kilometers an hours, meters, kilograms, and centimeters.
Save your workout goal information. If you edit the page and do not save the app will prompt you if you want to save changes. This will save if the workout goal is valid.

The official start date of your workout goal. Estimated and projected goal finish dates use this date in their calculations. You can view your goal progress on the home tab by clicking on the chart icon.
Your current age. This is used to determine max heart rate, daily calorie needs, and calories burned.
This is used to determine max daily calorie needs, and calories burned.
Your current weight at the start of a workout goal. This is used to determine calories burned and your current BMI (Body Mass Index).
Your current height. This is used to determine your current BMI (Body Mass Index).

Your average daily calorie intake. This is used to determine how many calories to burn per week to meet your goal. Losing weight is not only about burning calories, but also choosing a healthy diet. Cutting too many calories per day can be counterproductive to your bodies needs for strong muscles to exercise effectively. The minimum number of calories per day for men is 1800 and 1200 for women.

string.name: activity_level_help_sedentary
string.li: Sedentary Physical activity level (PAL) of (1.2). An example of this would be a office worker getting little or no exercise.

string.name: activity_level_help_light
string.li: Light Activity, an example of this PAL would be walking regularly or light exercise, PAL of (1.375).

string.name: activity_level_help_moderate
string.li: Moderate Activity, this includes exercising several times a week and pushing yourself pretty hard, PAL of (1.55). This can also include heavy housework, gardening, yardwork.

string.name: activity_level_help_very_active
string.li: Very Active, you work as a construction worker or you participate in sports, jogging, mountain biking daily, PAL of (1.7).

string.name: activity_level_help_ex_active
string.li: Extremely Active, this includes someone who may swim two hours daily, PAL of (2.0).

resources.string: PAL is calculated off total energy expenditure (TEE) over a 24 hour period, over base metabolic rate (BMR). PAL = (TEE/24hours)/BMR.
View pictures taken from this workout and previous workouts.
View workout information in a chart view. Workout information is stored if you are connected to the heart rate monitor.
Saves workout events, creates notifications, and adds events to Android\'s calendar application if add to calendar is marked.

Adds a new workout event. You can select the start and end date and the number of calories you would like to burn. A notification will notify you if it is 4 hours before the event and the event was not added with the prior 4 hours, events repeat weekly. You may also add events to Android\'s calendar application.
Evenly spreads calories to burn between the current events on the page.
This is asking if you want to add workout events to your phones calendar app.
The account email you used to setup your calendar. You can view this email in settings under accounts, Google.
This dropdown will show account names for a given account email.
This is asking if you want to synch workout events with your google calendar on the web or just to the calendar app on the phone.

Take a picture for this workout. The workout has to already be started. Images show up on the map in the proximated location the pictures was taken (If the picture is not showing up be sure to zoom in or move the map).
End a workout. Ending a workout enables you to start a new one with different category/subcategory, view workout information in a chart, and remove the workout with its associated information.
Take a picture for this workout. The workout has to already be started.

Utilizing Google maps you can map your workout with your phone\'s built in GPS. You can track speed, elevation, and distance. This information is also viewable in a chart after the workout has been ended.
View previous workouts. You can search for past workouts, remove workouts, view workout chart information, and view workout pictures.
End a workout. Ending a workout enables you to start a new one with different category/subcategory.
Starts a new workout if there is a workout that has not been ended. Starts/Stops a existing workout.
Connect to ZEPHYR HxM Heart Rate Monitor through bluetooth.
Connecting to Heart Rate Monitor through bluetooth.
Connected to Heart Rate Monitor through bluetooth.

The time for a given workout in hours, minutes, and seconds. Clicking the watch starts/stops the timer. End workout ends a workout so you can start a new workout. Workouts can only have one category/subcategory. It is recommended to end and create a new workout if changing the type of exercise.
The number of calories burned during this workout.
The bluetooth button in the action bar will connect to a heart rate device if available. Currently this app is configured to work with ZEPHYR HxM Heart Rate Monitor.

The workout category/subcategory is used to determine calories burned if there is no heart rate monitor or the bluetooth connection is lost. Each workout subcategory has a certain amount of Metabolic Equivalent of Tasks (METS) assigned to it. The formula for calories burned is ((Weight lbs/2.2) * METS). If connected to the heart rate monitor the calories burned is calculated by ((-55.0969 + (0.6309*heart rate) + (0.1988*kilogram weight) + (0.2017* age))/4.184)*60.0 = calories per hour for men. For woman the formula used is ((-20.4022 + (0.4472*heart rate) + (0.1263*kilogram weight) + (0.074* age))/4.184)*60.0 = calories per hour.
The scheduled workout event calories to burn minus the number of calories burned today.

string.name: map_accuracy_default
string.li: Default 100 meter accuracy while on the workout map page, when phone is asleep a reading is taken about every 20 seconds.

string.name: map_accuracy_fine
string.li: Best accuracy available while on the workout map page, when phone is asleep a reading is taken about every 10 seconds. This consumes battery life faster.

string.name: map_accuracy_conserve
string.li: 100 meter accuracy while on the workout map page, when phone is asleep a reading is taken about every minute.

resources.string: Please refer to the workout tab for general workout info help. The workout map ties into the maps app to record where you have been.
The distance you have covered while the timer is going.
Your current speed based off of the previous location reading.
The max speed you reached during the workout while the timer was on.
The amount of elevation you have gained and declined during your workout. This is either in feet or meters depending on the formatting setting.
